content: Yes, the principles of the Treaty of Westphalia are likely to continue shaping international relations in the future. The ideas of state sovereignty and territorial integrity are still considered fundamental principles of modern international law and are widely recognized as the basis for legitimate state authority. While there are some ongoing debates about the limits of state sovereignty and the rights of individuals within states, the principles established by the Treaty of Westphalia are likely to remain an important foundation for the global system of states. At the same time, the balance of power and diplomatic protocols established by the Treaty of Westphalia will likely continue to be relevant in shaping international relations, especially as new challenges emerge such as cyberwarfare, climate change, and emerging technologies.
